*[Overview]* > *[EditCell Editing cells]* > Custom cell editors
= Introduction =

In the JEditable plugin text box is default cell editor, however, JEditable plugin that is used for editing provides other editor types.  

!DataTable Editable plugin supports inline editing of varous input types (text box, textarea, select list etc). Editing is implemented 				using <a href="http://www.appelsiini.net/projects/jeditable">JQuery JEditable plugin</a>. To initialize the editors that wll be applied on the columns, parameter aoColumns needs to be set in the plugin initialization call as shown in the following example:

{{{
<script type="text/javascript" charset="utf-8">
$(document).ready(function () {
    $('#example').dataTable().makeEditable({
        sUpdateURL: "UpdateData.php",
        "aoColumns": [
                    	null,
                    	{
                        },
                    	{
                    		indicator: 'Saving platforms...',
                    		tooltip: 'Click to edit platforms',
                    		type: 'textarea'
                    	},
                    	{
                    		type: 'select',
                    		onblur: 'cancel',
                    		submit: 'Ok',
                    		loadurl: 'EngineVersionList.php',
                    		loadtype: 'GET'
                    	},
                    	{
                    		type: 'select',
                    		onblur: 'submit',
                    		data: "{'':'Please select...', 'A':'A','B':'B','C':'C'}"
                    	}
					]
    });
})
</script>
}}}

This is an array of settings that will be applied on table columns. This array should have the same number of columns as original table.

Editor properties that are set in this array are identical to the properties of  <a href="http://www.appelsiini.net/projects/jeditable">JQuery JEditable plugin</a>. DataTables Editable plugin delegates cell editing functionalities to the JEditable plugin and just passes properties in the aoColumns to the editors for the particular columns.

See how these setting are applied on the [http://jquery-datatables-editable.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/custom-editors.html live demo page].
